channel.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
channel.description:
Hey looking for some help from you guys. Ok basically my girlfriend is a grade 8 pianist and goes to the royal music accademy in london. Anyways she has a grand piano worth about £7,000 in her house and she was playing something on it while i was there. On top of the key cover thing i put a pencil on it, and she lifted the cover up and it slid into the piano. Now when ever she plays a note somewhere around where the pencil went in it makes a ratteling sound. Her parents will not be pleased with me if they find out this has happened. So im asking for you guys to get me a solution on how to get this thing out of the piano. theres no way my hand will fit in this crack (lol yes ive tried). Anyways thought i'd post this here to see what responses i will get. I'll draw a diagram of where the pencil is in a moment lol
edit - damn drawing a diagram of this is harder then i thought.

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“therealjdb, post:20, topic:63920”]If the crack is big enough I’d recommend using one of those flexible grabber tools that you can get from the hardware store. If not that then pipe cleaner/coat hangers.

Flexible thingy:
[/quote]
lol awesome, i had one of them a while ago when i thought it was fun to clean my street. lol.

Well i havent had a chance to get to my gf’s house… and its probably going to be a month or two untill i do. (weird yeah i know)

Anyways i was at school yesterday and my friend put his guitar plectrum on top of the piano, much similar but a bit smaller to my gf’s, he lifted the lid up and the plectrum slid straight into the place where my pen had gone in at my gf’s house (lol). So yeah we decided to try and lift the lid up… it worked :o and he grabbed his pic and we took another 10 minutes getting the lid back on.

But i think my gfs piano and this piano are similar so im going to attempt to try this soon.

  • oh also thanks alot for all the help peoples.

Read full topic

@mikkomainer wrote:

therealjdb’s thing could work, I have one of those and they work very well in many things.

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

For relative risk, I’m going to go with “ask her parents” vs. “break £7,000 piano” - if you’re too worried about the backlash, be a man and have her pretend like she did it.

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @93dcthugs93 93dcthugs93
item.description:
@93dcthugs93 wrote:

heres my way of doing things like this.

Take the Piano and lift it up off the ground.
Turn it around and shake it until the pencil falls out.

If you can’t pick it up then get a crane or something and do it. Or… you could do it the harder way and take some duct tape or regular tape, stick it to a long object and touch the pencil with it, lift the pencil out of the piano.

Read full topic

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Well, is it an upright or a grand piano? If it’s an upright, you pull up the lid on the top, stick something between the lid and the hinge it’s on so the lid doesn’t fall off, and then the thing in the front can be lifted off vertically. If it’s a grand piano, it’s the same deal except I think the front part comes out horizontally

Read full topic

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

Lift the top panel as far back as it will go, and then you should be able to lift the top out and then remove the pencil.

Which top bit are we talking about? the lid? the lid of the keys? thanks for helping btw.

Read full topic

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Lol well consider:
Her parents wont let me in the house on my own, or with just my gf (obviously we’d be running about the house naked if they wernt there)
So that rules out the possibility of getting a guy to come look at it.
And i’d never attempt to unscrew the thing… if i broke it i’d be in deep shit.
I think i’d go with either the pipe cleaner idea, or the apology idea.

Read full topic

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

I would say just find a piano store, and ask the owner if he can fix it. Most piano shops have somebody in there who can tune your piano for you when it needs tuning, and im sure that they would be able to take a key off for you. He shouldnt ask for too much money, but you never know. Its probably worth it in the long run, considering you have an 80% chance of completely fucking up her piano trying yourself

Read full topic

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

This is going to sound stupid but see if you can unscrew the bottom. If its not a really cheap piano this won’t work because they are glued together. I hope you find away. (On another note, if nothing works just say it was an accident and your sorry)

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Yeah the top is easily opened, infact its nearly always open when im around there, they are opened to amplify the sound. But the pencil is lodged underneath the strings somewhere unknown to me, but ive had a good look around and cant see it.

I’ll see what i can do next time.
Im pretty sure i cant lift that thing though

Read full topic

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Hmm about how big is the crack. Is is possible to post a picture?

Maybe get a flashlight and try to shine it in to locate the pencil.

Also, I know pianos can be heavy but have you tried to lift to one side and possibly tilt the pencil to roll into a more accessible area?
And I thought pianos could open? Cause they have to open somehow so they can be tuned.

Read full topic

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

i was thinking that. I do not at this moment possess pipe cleaners lol.
And next time im going to her house is in a few weeks so i suppose i could aquire some pipe cleaners.
The thing is, i cant actually see where the pencil has gone… i mean for all i know it could have rolled all the way to the bottom of the piano … =/ thanks for suggestions.

Read full topic

item.title: My girls piano....[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Maybe form some pipe-cleaners or some other thin, semi-strong material is the crack and try to push it out of the way.

With the pipe-cleaners you could create two separate “hooks” and try and lift the pencil.

Read full topic
